channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report E-2024040574
item.description:
Report E-2024040574

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: TOMS BROOK
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 16, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and asphalt below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed absorbents to the release and worked them in with hand tools. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew then overpacked the damaged pails in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024041169
item.description:
Report X-2024041169

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: ALEXANDRIA
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HAZMAT AUDITOR WAS DOING THE 3 DAY UNDELCARED HAZMAT SHIPPER AUDIT FOUND 2 PACKAGES THAT IS COVERED BY BLACK PLASTIC. FOUND HAZMAT MARKINGS - 12 AEROSOLS, LIMITED QUANTITY MARK AND ARROWS POINTING UP. HAZMAT AUDITOR CALLED THE HMMS FOR UNDELCARED HAZMATS AND FOLLOWED THE INSTRUCTION GIVEN BY THE HMMS REPRRESENTATIVE. AEROSOLS, FLAMMABLE. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER: 1Z1718EA0397361736. BOXES WERE COVERED IN BLACK PLASTIC; INNER BOXES MARKED WITH GROUND LTD QTY MARKING

item.title: Report E-2024040468
item.description:
Report E-2024040468

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-24T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-13
  • City: GLADE SPRING
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 13, 2024, at 2240 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Glade Spring, Virginia regarding the release of approximately 45 gallons of METHYL ETHYL KETONE (UN1193, 3, III) from (4) 55-gallon DM’s. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was caused by multiple pallets breaking creating punctures and was contained to the trailer floor and a 1ft x 1ft area of asphalt beneath the trailer. Contractors were able to clean the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated was placed in (1) 55-gallon DM, and the 4 damaged drums with remaining product were each placed in 85-gallon DM overpacks and was taken offsite by contractors.

item.title: Report X-2024040947
item.description:
Report X-2024040947

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-30
  • City: NORFOLK
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. 1 fiberboard box: UN1789 containing (5 fiberboard boxes) was discovered leaking on the bottom. Inner contents: 5 fiberboard boxes smaller boxes. One of the inner boxes, which was leaking, had been packed upside down (indicated by the orientation arrows on each inner box. The contents of each inner box were 1 glass bottle, held in place with Styrofoam. Remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.
